text: The 1981-82 Austrian Cup was the national cup in Austrian football. Grazer AK were the defending champions. Austria Soccer == First round == First round with teams from the second league. ==Round of 32== First round with teams from the first league. ==Round of 16== ==Quarter finals== ==Semi-finals== ==Final== *First match *SSW Innsbruck: Fuad Đulić – Vesely Schenk, Robert Auer (42. Günther Seebacher), Werner Schwarz, Arnold Koreimann, Herwig Kircher, Roland Hattenberger, Andreas Gretschnig, Helmut Weigl, Ewald Gröss, Manfred Braschler (71. Gert Jørgensen) coach:Franz Wolny * FK Austria Wien: Friedl Koncilia – Robert Sara, Josef Sara, Erich Obermayer, Johann Dihanich, Franz Zore, Felix Gasselich (87. Ruben Plaza), Karl Daxbacher, Ernst Baumeister, Gerhard Steinkogler, Petko Petkov (82. Franz Zach) coach: Václav Halama *Second match: *FK Austria Wien: Friedl Koncilia – Erich Obermayer, Robert Frind (66. Josef Sara), Johann Dihanich, Ruben Plaza, Felix Gasselich, Harald Fürst, Karl Daxbacher, Ernst Baumeister, Gerhard Steinkogler, Thomas N'Gobe (66. Petko Petkov) coach: Václav Halama * SSW Innsbruck: Fuad Đulić – Vesely Schenk, Helmut Weigl, Werner Schwarz, Arnold Koreimann, Herwig Kircher, Roland Hattenberger, Andreas Gretschnig, Werner Zanon, Ewald Gröss, Manfred Braschler coach:Franz Wolny ==Top goalscorers== Rank Player Club Goals 1 Josef Stering Grazer AK 6 2 Richard Niederbacher SK Sturm Graz 5 2 Max Hagmayr VOEST Linz 5 4 Bozo Bakota SK Sturm Graz 4 Scorerlist(German) ==References== Category:Austrian Cup Category:1982 in European football Category:1980s in Austria
title: 1981–82 Austrian Cup
